title: BOC able to Approve Bereavement/Family Medical Emergency Transaction
custom_preconds: Given user is logged in as BOC user (test_boc_approver@mlb.com/pass@HEARD)
custom_steps:
Select a player form MJ roster widget > Click Create New on a player History > 
Select Transaction > Major > Inactive List >Approve Bereavement/Family Medical Emergency Transaction
custom_expected: *Clicking Approve user able to see a Blue Succesfull Approve message

title: BOC can Reverse tx
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user logged in as BOC (test_boc_approver@mlb.com/pass@HEARD) 
and has completed approved transaction
custom_steps:
Select a player from MJ roster widget > Clicks Create New on Player's History >
Selects Transaction > Major > Inactive List > Bereavement/Family Medical Emergency >Approve the transaction 

When user click Reverse
custom_expected:
The transaction is reversed
AND successful notification appears
AND status is updated in tx and player history
AND player's pending status is reversed
IF the player has an outstanding tx then show error

title: Club receives notification when tx is Approved
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC (test_boc_approver@mlb.com/pass@HEARD) 
has approved the transaction
custom_steps:
Click on Advanced Search > Search For (Transactions)>Transaction Type > Paternity Leave > Click on Approved Transaction 

When the club views  their notifications
custom_expected:
THEN transaction appears
AND links work

title: Approved Major League Paternity list tx create an entry in the daily tx bulletin
custom_preconds:
Given user is logged in as BOC user (test_boc_approver@mlb.com/pass@HEARD) 
and has completed Approve Paternity list transaction
custom_steps:
Select a player from MJ roster widget > Clicks Create New on Player's History >
Selects Transaction > Major > Inactive List >Paternity Leave >Approve the transaction
After Approving the transaction > Click Transaction from menu > select to  Daily Transaction Bulletin
custom_expected: *The transaction should appear on the current Pending Daily Transaction Bulletin as "Placed on Major League Paternity List"

title: User can receive a notification on the 3rd day of a player's Paternity List placement
custom_preconds:
Given user is logged in as BOC user (test_boc_approver@mlb.com/pass@HEARD) 
and has completed Approve Paternity list transaction
custom_steps:
Select a player from MJ roster widget > Clicks Create New on Player's History >
Selects Transaction > Major > Inactive List >Paternity Leave > change the placement date 3 day back from current date and Approve the transaction

WHEN the user runs nightly notification batch from Utilities >Batches > General > Click on nightly notification batch
custom_expected:
THEN a new notification is generated for both the BOC- Major Transactions- Admin and the Club- Major Transactions- Admin users. 
AND Type will be Inactive List. 
AND The notification description should be Please Reinstate from Major League Paternity List. 
AND Both the player name and the notification description should link to the Player's Player History.

title: BOC user can approve a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction for major player
custom_preconds: Given user is logged in as BOC user (test_boc_approver@mlb.com/pass@HEARD)
custom_steps:
Select a player form MJ roster widget  which has  roster status of Paternity leave , Pending Suspended list or Voluntarily Retired list 
> Click Create New on a player History > Select Transaction > Major > Inactive List >Reinstate from Inactive list
When clicking Approve
custom_expected:
* The transaction status is updated to "Approved"
* If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
* A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved.
* Update player's MJ or MN Roster Statuses accordingly to be what it was prior to being placed on the Inactive List, unless "Do Not Activate" checkbox is checked.
* If Do Not Activate checkbox is checked, set the player's Roster status to "Reinstated/Not Active"

title: User can create a new Reinstate from Inactive List transaction for Minor league player
custom_preconds: Given user is logged in as BOC user (test_boc_approver@mlb.com/pass@HEARD)
custom_steps:
Select a player form MN roster widget which has roster status of Paternity leave , Pending Suspended list or Voluntarily Retired list

Click Create New on a player History > Select Transaction > Minor League > Inactive List >Reinstate from Inactive list
when selecting "Reinstate from Inactive List" from the Create New
When clicking Approve
custom_expected:
*The transaction status is updated to "Approved"
*If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode.
*A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved.
*Update player's MJ or MN Roster Statuses accordingly to be what it was prior to being placed on the Inactive List, unless "Do Not Activate" checkbox is checked.
*If Do Not Activate checkbox is checked, set the player's Roster status to "Reinstated/Not Active"

title: Club user receive a notification Reinstate from Inactive List transaction if it is Approved, Rejected, or Reversed
custom_preconds:
Given user is logged in as BOC user (test_boc_approver@mlb.com/pass@HEARD)

and has prior completed Reinstate from Inactive List transaction
custom_steps: When a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction is Approved, Rejected, or Reversed by BOC
custom_expected:
*Club that the player belongs to will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Approved or Rejected or Reversed
AND Description will be a hyperlink

title: BOC user can create a new Place on Deceased List transaction for a MN player
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as BOC (test-BOC-approver@mlb.com/pass@HEARD)
custom_steps:
Select a player form MN roster widget > Click Create New on a player History > 
Select Transaction > Minor League > Inactive List >Place on Deceased List
When Click Approve
custom_expected:
**The transaction status is updated to "Approved"
* if no Preliminary "Place on Deceased List" tx exists within the last 10 days, selecting "Place on Deceased List" will cause the system to load a new preliminary transaction
BUT if a Preliminary "Place on Deceased List" tx does exist within the last 10 days system should load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction
*System should update Player's Player History: Code = DEAD (NOT displayed on front end) , Description = Place on Deceased List , From Org/Club and To Org/Club fields to be in black fon
*System should Update player's MJ or MN Roster Statuses to be "Deceased"

title: BOC user can create a new place on Deceased list transaction for MJ player
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as BOC (test-BOC-approver@mlb.com/pass@HEARD)
custom_steps:
Select a player form MJ roster widget > Click Create New on a player History > 
Select Transaction > Major League > Inactive List >Place on Deceased List

WHEN user clicks "Approve"
custom_expected:
*The system load blue notification "the transaction successfully approved"
*System should update Player's Player History: Code = DEAD (NOT displayed on front end) , Description = Place on Deceased List , From Org/Club and To Org/Club fields to be in black font
*System should Update player's MJ or MN Roster Statuses to be "Deceased"

title: BOC user able to edit an existing Place on Deceased List transaction for a player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC (test-BOC-approver@mlb.com/pass@HEARD)
 And has completed Approve transaction
custom_steps: When user clicks edit
custom_expected:
THEN system will reload in edit mode AND a "Save" button should appear in place of the "Edit" button
AND user should be able to edit all portions displayed on the form

title: BOC user able to print NOD for a place on Place on Disqualified List transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC (test-BOC-approver@mlb.com/pass@HEARD)
and has prior approve transaction
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks print on the tx in view or edit mode
custom_expected:
*Notice of Disposition will generate a pdf of the Notice of Disposition in English if the language on the player's profile is set to English.
*Notice of Disposition will generate a pdf of the Notice of Disposition in Spanish if the language on the player's profile is set to Spanish.

title: BOC user will able to Reverse or Reverse and Suppress Disqualified List transaction

GIVEN user is logged in as BOC (test-BOC-approver@mlb.com/pass@HEARD)
And has prior completed approve transaction
custom_steps: When Clicking Reverse or Revers and Suppress
custom_expected: *The System load blue notification "the transaction successfully "Reversed" or Suppressed

title: BOC User can create a Place on Military List Transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as BOC (test-BOC-approver@mlb.com/pass@HEARD)
custom_steps:
Select a player form MJ roster widget > Click Create New on a player History > 
Select Transaction > Major League > Inactive List > Place on Military List

WHEN user clicks "Approve
custom_expected: *The system load blue notification "The transaction Successfully Approved"

title: BOC user can reverse a Place on Military List tx
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC (test-BOC-approver@mlb.com/pass@HEARD)
and has prior completed Approve transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Reverse" button
custom_expected:
*System should run all required field and formatting checks and display relevant error or warning messages
*Successful Reverse notification should display
*Transaction status should update to "Reversed"
*Reversed transaction should display in Player History with "Voided" in front of the transaction
*Player's MJ and MN Roster Status, Club and Org should be set to values from prior to transaction approval

title: Club User can Submit a Place on Military list transaction for MN player

custom_steps:
Select a player form MN roster widget > Click Create New on a player History > 
Select Transaction > Minor League Roaster > Inactive List > Place on Military List >Submit to BOC
custom_expected: *The System load Blue notification "the Transaction Successfully Submitted"

title: BOC user can reject a Place on Military List tx
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC (test-BOC-approver@mlb.com/pass@HEARD
AND Has Completed prior minor league Place on Military Transaction in a state of Submitted to BOC
custom_steps: WHEN Viewing the submitted to BOC transaction, BOC User able to  Click  "Reject"
custom_expected:
* The transaction status is updated to "Rejected"
* Successful reject notification is displayed. See Messages #15.
* If the item was on the Approvals Clipboard, that is removed from the approvals clipboard. 
* Reverse player's Pending org and club. 
* Remove pending player history entry.

title: User can edit existing Place on Military List transaction for a player

and has prior completed Approved transaction
custom_steps: When Clicking Edit
custom_expected:

* BOC is able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions

title: BOC user can approve or reject a Place on Voluntarily Retired List tx
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC (test-BOC-approver@mlb.com/pass@HEARD

custom_steps:

WHEN clicking Approve or Reject
custom_expected:

Successful reject notification is displayed. See Messages #15.

AND Reverse player's Pending org and club. 
AND Remove pending player history entry.
